member.name: M:HurPsyExp.App.Application_Startup(System.Object,System.Windows.StartupEventArgs)
member.summary: The handler function for the application's Startup event. At this stage, the application will let the user to open up a window to design an experiment, or open up another window to run an experiment. This is an implementation based on a tutorial found at: https://wpf-tutorial.com/wpf-application/working-with-app-xaml/

member.name: T:HurPsyExp.ExpDesign.DesignViewModel
member.summary: This VM class will handle the exchange of data input on the experiment design interface

member.name: F:HurPsyExp.ExpDesign.DesignViewModel._experiment
member.summary: The reference variable for the object representing the experiment's definition

member.name: P:HurPsyExp.ExpDesign.DesignViewModel.StimulusVMs
member.summary: Observable collection of the viewmodels which will help edit/display stimulus definitions

member.name: P:HurPsyExp.ExpDesign.DesignViewModel.LocatorVMs
member.summary: Observable collection of the viewmodels which will help edit/display locator definitions

member.name: P:HurPsyExp.ExpDesign.DesignViewModel.BlockVMs
member.summary: Observable collection of the viewmodels which will help edit/display trial blocks

member.name: M:HurPsyExp.ExpDesign.DesignViewModel.#ctor
member.summary: This default constructor simply starts with empty lists of the inner viewmodel objects

member.name: M:HurPsyExp.ExpDesign.DesignViewModel.ClearVMs
member.summary: This private method clears all lists of viewmodel objects before loading or starting a new experiment definition.

member.name: M:HurPsyExp.ExpDesign.DesignViewModel.NewExperiment
member.summary: The method which will create a new experiment definition when the associated command is executed

member.name: M:HurPsyExp.ExpDesign.DesignViewModel.LoadExperiment
member.summary: The method which will load an experiment definition from a file when the associated command is executed (Choosing the definition file and loading of the experiment is left to `Utility.LoadExperiment()` method because it depends on the runtime environment)

member.name: M:HurPsyExp.ExpDesign.DesignViewModel.SaveExperiment
member.summary: The method which will save an experiment definition to a file when the associated command is executed (Creating the definition file and saving the experiment definition is left to `Utility.SaveExperiment()` method because it depends on the runtime environment)

member.name: M:HurPsyExp.ExpDesign.DesignViewModel.SelectImages
member.summary: The method which will load image stimuli from files selected by the user when the associated command is executed. (Choosing the image files is left to the `Utility.OpenFiles()` method, because it depends on the runtime environment)

member.name: M:HurPsyExp.ExpDesign.DesignViewModel.AddHtmlStimulus
member.summary: The method which will load and HTML stimulus from a file selected by the user when the associated command is executed. (Choosing the file is left to the `Utility.OpenFiles()` method, because it depends on the runtime environment)

member.name: M:HurPsyExp.ExpDesign.DesignViewModel.AddStimulusVM(HurPsyLib.Stimulus)
member.summary: Create and add a viewmodel object associated with a `Stimulus` object

member.name: M:HurPsyExp.ExpDesign.DesignViewModel.Stimvm_IdChanged(System.Object,HurPsyExp.ExpDesign.IdChangeEventArgs)
member.summary: This method will handle the `IdChanged` events for `StimulusVM` objects
member.param: The object reporting the id change

member.name: M:HurPsyExp.ExpDesign.DesignViewModel.AddPointLocator
member.summary: This method will create and add a `PointLocator` object to the experiment definition

member.name: M:HurPsyExp.ExpDesign.DesignViewModel.AddLocatorVM(HurPsyLib.Locator)
member.summary: This method will create and add a viewmodel object associated with a `Locator` object

member.name: M:HurPsyExp.ExpDesign.DesignViewModel.Locvm_IdChanged(System.Object,HurPsyExp.ExpDesign.IdChangeEventArgs)
member.summary: This method will handle the `IdChanged` events for `LocatorVM` objects
member.param: The object reporting the id change

member.name: M:HurPsyExp.ExpDesign.DesignViewModel.DeleteStimulus
member.summary: This method which delete the `Stimulus` objects selected on the experiment design interface when the associated command is executed.

member.name: M:HurPsyExp.ExpDesign.DesignViewModel.DeleteLocator
member.summary: This method which delete the `Locator` objects selected on the experiment design interface when the associated command is executed.

member.name: M:HurPsyExp.ExpDesign.DesignViewModel.AddBlock
member.summary: This method will create and add a block of trials to the experiment definition when the associated command is executed.

member.name: M:HurPsyExp.ExpDesign.DesignViewModel.DeleteBlock
member.summary: This method will deleted a block of trials selected on the experiment design interface when the associated command is executed.

member.name: T:HurPsyExp.ExpDesign.ItemViewModel
member.summary: This abstract class is the base of viewmodel classes which simply wrap certain model objects. It has the ability to toggle a boolean property Selected and a TempId property to serve as a proxy for the Id properties of Stimulus and Locator objects.

member.name: M:HurPsyExp.ExpDesign.ItemViewModel.OnTempIdChanged(System.String)
member.summary: Executes the logic for when just changed.
member.param: The new property value that was set.
member.remarks: This method is invoked right after the value of is changed.

member.name: T:HurPsyExp.ExpDesign.TempStep
member.summary: This class will serve as a boilerplate for one or more steps that an experiment designer wants to add to a trial.

member.name: T:HurPsyExp.ExpDesign.TempTrial
member.summary: This class will serve as a boilerplate for one or more trials that an experiment designer wants to add to a block. When the designer presses the "Add Trial(s)" button on AddTrialView, trials with the steps formed by combinations of desired pairs will be added to the active block.

member.name: T:HurPsyExp.Utility
member.summary: This static class will handle mundane operations like opening and saving files, etc. which fall outside the jurisdiction of the design app.
